title: Multi-Literacy-Based Mathematics Learning Strategies for Digital Natives

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-Level Mathematical Knowledge and Basic Proficiency with Digital Tools
context.additional_context: A course for corporate managers/leaders to improve mathematical application skills, applying learning strategies that combine multiliteracies (critical and functional literacy) in digital environments

learning_goals: Learners can solve mathematical modeling problems using digital tools (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.) and visually represent results.
Learners can critically evaluate math problem-solving strategies based on peer feedback using online collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Jamboard).
Through project-based assessment, learners can propose data analysis and decision-making strategies applicable to real-world work scenarios.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
